intro: Pittosporum senacia subsp. pervillei, commonly known as the New Zealand pittosporum, is a shrub or small tree native to New Zealand. It features lance-shaped leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by bright orange berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
